verses.verse: "As for you, take<WH5375> up a lamentation<WH7015> for the princes<WH5387> of Israel,<WH3478>

and say,<WH559> 'What<WH4100> was your mother<WH517>? A lioness<WH3833> among<WH996> lions!<WH738> She lay<WH7257> down<WH7257> among<WH8432> young<WH3715> lions,<WH3715> She reared<WH7235> her cubs.<WH1482>
'When she brought<WH5927> up one<WH259> of her cubs,<WH1482> He became<WH1961> a lion,<WH3715> And he learned<WH3925> to tear<WH2963> [his] prey;<WH2964> He devoured<WH398> men.<WH120>
'Then nations<WH1471> heard<WH8085> about<WH413> him; He was captured<WH8610> in their pit,<WH7845> And they brought<WH935> him with hooks<WH2397> To the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
'When she saw,<WH7200> as she waited,<WH3176> [That] her hope<WH8615> was lost, She took<WH6> another<WH3947> of her cubs<WH259> And made<WH1482> him a young<WH7760> lion.<WH3715>
'And he walked<WH1980> about among<WH8432> the lions;<WH738> He became<WH1961> a young<WH3715> lion,<WH3715> He learned<WH3925> to tear<WH2963> [his] prey;<WH2964> He devoured<WH398> men.<WH120>

'And he destroyed<WH9570> their fortified<WH490> towers<WH759> And laid<WH2717> waste<WH2717> their cities;<WH5892> And the land<WH776> and its fulness<WH4393> were appalled<WH3456> Because<WH4480> of the sound<WH6963> of his roaring.<WH7581>

'Then nations<WH1471> set<WH5414> against<WH5921> him On every<WH5439> side<WH5439> from [their] provinces,<WH4082> And they spread<WH6566> their net<WH7568> over<WH5921> him; He was captured<WH8610> in their pit.<WH7845>

'And they put<WH5414> him in a cage<WH5474> with hooks<WH2397> And brought<WH935> him to the king<WH4428> of Babylon;<WH894> They brought<WH935> him in hunting<WH4685> nets<WH4685> So<WH4616> that his voice<WH6963> should be heard<WH8085> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> On the mountains<WH2022> of Israel.<WH3478>

'Your mother<WH517> was like a vine<WH1612> in your vineyard, Planted<WH8362> by the waters;<WH4325> It was fruitful<WH6509> and full<WH6058> of branches<WH6058> Because<WH4480> of abundant<WH7227> waters.<WH4325>

'And it had<WH1961> strong<WH5797> branches<WH4294> [fit] for scepters<WH7626> of rulers,<WH4910> And its height<WH6967> was raised<WH1361> above<WH5921> <WH996> the clouds<WH5688> So that it was seen<WH7200> in its height<WH1363> with the mass<WH7230> of its branches.<WH1808>

'But it was plucked<WH5428> up in fury;<WH2534> It was cast<WH7993> down<WH7993> to the ground;<WH776> And the east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> dried<WH3001> up its fruit.<WH6529> Its strong<WH5797> branch<WH4294> was torn<WH6561> off<WH6561> So that it withered;<WH3001> The fire<WH784> consumed<WH398> it.
'And now<WH6258> it is planted<WH8362> in the wilderness,<WH4057> In a dry<WH6723> and thirsty<WH6772> land.<WH776>

'And fire<WH784> has gone<WH3318> out from [its] branch;<WH4294> It has consumed<WH398> its shoots<WH909> [and] fruit,<WH6529> So that there is not in it a strong<WH5797> branch,<WH4294> A scepter<WH7626> to rule.<WH4910>' "This<WH1931> is a lamentation,<WH7015> and has become<WH1961> a lamentation.<WH7015>
